intro: Polyscias sandwicensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian glorybower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a glossy appearance. Polyscias sandwicensis is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and is often found in moist, shaded forest environments.
